title: Government urged to alter 'perverse' negative gearing and CGT discounts | ABC NEWS
description: Economist and Grattan Institute CEO Aruna Sathanapally says negative gearing and capital gains tax discounts have contributed to Australia's housing crisis, with income earners unable to afford modest houses in the middle ring suburbs around capital cities. title: HungryPanda alleges blackmail, intimidation amid industrial dispute with delivery riders | ABC NEWS
description: Food delivery company HungryPanda has accused some workers of attempting to intimidate fellow riders who refused to take their side in an industrial dispute during the Lunar New Year period.  The company says it contacted police in China after attempting to report the allegations to Australian authorities. HungryPanda's allegations follow earlier claims from workers that Chinese police had been pressuring them and their families back home. title: Magda Szubanski announces blood cancer remission | ABC NEWS
description: Australian comedian Magda Szubanski, who was diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of blood cancer in May 2025, has announced she's in remission.  The 64-year-old star, who is best known for her role as Sharon Strzelecki in Kath and Kim, thanked the public for the "tsunami" of love and support she has received throughout her treatment in a video posted on Instagram.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Egos, fresh faces and redemption on the cards for NRL 2026
description: The NRL season is kicking off in Vegas this weekend and there are plenty of threads to pull ahead of the 2026 season getting underway. Can the Broncos find and harness the magic of last season or will the premiership go to their heads? Will back-to-back Grand Final losses make or break the Storm and do the Panthers rise again? Plus there’s always a dark horse so who might it be in season 2026?   Featured: Nick Campton, ABC SPORT.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Airstrikes hit Afghanistan hours after Taliban attacks Pakistan | ABC NEWS
description: Pakistan has bombed major cities in Afghanistan, including the capital Kabul. The Pakistani defence minister declared the neighbours are at "open war" following months of clashes. South Asia bureau chief Meghana Bali says journalists on the ground in the Afghan capital heard explosions and gunfire after a shaky ceasefire between the two countries ended. title: One Nation faces first electoral test in Farrer since polls bounce | Casey Briggs | ABC NEWS
description: Former Liberal leader Sussan Ley has officially handed in her resignation letter two weeks after losing the leadership of the Liberal Party and stepping away from politics, placing her NSW seat of Farrer up for grabs. ABC Chief Elections Analyst Casey Briggs explains who is in the running for the historically safe Liberal seat, and whether One Nation are in with a fighting chance. title: 'Embrace AI change' says Macquarie Technology CEO as it expands data centres | The Business
description: Macquarie Technology Group has recorded its 22nd straight half yearly growth of EBITDA. On a statutory basis, profit fell 9 per cent to $16.3 million and revenue rose 5 per cent. Macquarie Technology CEO David Tudehope says "It's so important we embrace the AI change. I've been in industry a long time. In my mind this is as big as the internet in 1998. This will change everyone's lives." he said. This week, logistics software company WiseTech Global announced its cutting 2,000 roles as a result of AI, while the owner of Afterpay, Block in the US, is cutting its workforce by 4,000 jobs. On job losses, Mr Tudehope is reasonably optimistic "I don't think what you're seeing in the headlines over the last week is what I'm seeing corporate Australia" he said. There was a raft of corporate results this week. Coles share price went down, down just like its campaign slogan after it announced a fall in half year profit and Qantas posted a flat result as Vanessa Hudson continued to refresh the airline. This segment is presented by Alicia Barry.  #ABCBusiness  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: NSW, Victoria and SA to receive heaviest rain in over a decade | ABC NEWS
description: Angus Hines from the Bureau of Meteorology says an unusual weather system is bringing rain usually seen only in the far north tropics to the southern and eastern parts of the territory and the far west of Queensland. Severe weather warnings remain for those areas for further heavy rainfall tonight and into the weekend. South Australia  can expect heavy rain over the weekend as the system moves south. Rain is also expected to increase across southeastern Australia and western Victoria, with over 100mm forecast in many locations. title: ASX posts third record high, Netflix scraps Warner takeover bid | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: Netflix abandoned its plans to take over Warner Bros Discovery, leaving Paramount as the winner of their bidding war — with its $156 billion buyout offer. title: Hillary Clinton slams Epstein committee after hours of questioning | ABC NEWS
description: Former US secretary of state Hillary Clinton has grilled a Republican-led committee of Congress for summoning her to answer questions about Jeffrey Epstein, without doing the same for Donald Trump. The former first lady faced Congress for several hours behind closed doors, questioned about her own and husband Bill Clinton's ties to the late sex offender. title: Labor not ruling out negative gearing changes | ABC NEWS
description: Property investors have been put on notice with the federal treasurer strongly hinting he plans to clamp down on housing tax breaks in this year's budget. Jim Chalmers isn't ruling out changes to both capital gains tax and negative gearing in a bid to boost rates of home ownership. National Affairs Correspondent Jane Norman reports. title: Protestor arrested as NT Administrator David Connolly sworn in | ABC NEWS
description: A man has been arrested at a protest opposing the Country Liberal Party's selection for the role of the Northern Territory's new administrator. The appointment has been subject to controversy since old social media posts from David Connolly resurfaced in January. Mr Connolly has been sworn in to the role by NT government officials and the Governor-General. By Jack Hislop for ABC News Northern Territory.
